name: Gianbattista Guidotti
introduction: Gianbattista Guidotti (born 30 January 1902 and died 2 July 1994) was an Italian team manager and racing driver. After World War II, he became AlfaRomeo's team manager. At the 1950 British Grand Prix and 1951 Swiss Grand Prix he attended the races as a substitute driver for Alfa Romeo, but his services were not needed during the weekend.
